meanings.definition: A factual written account of important or historical events in the order of their occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The ancient chronicle detailed the battles fought by the warriors.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading the chronicle of our town's history.
meanings.sent3: The chronicle of the cat's adventures made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her life was a chronicle of triumphs and setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The chronicle of the shipwreck was both thrilling and heartbreaking.

meanings.definition: To record or document events in a factual and detailed way.
meanings.sent1: She would chronicle her daily activities in a journal.
meanings.sent2: Historians chronicle the rise and fall of civilizations.
meanings.sent3: I will chronicle your journey in a creative manner.
meanings.sent4: His songs chronicle the emotions of a generation.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to chronicle the changing seasons through paintings.
